variable.longName: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface
Net longwave radiation at the surface
Surface Net Sensible Heat Flux
Surface Net Latent Heat Flux

The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell reported as missing where the land fraction is 0 excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

variable.standardName: Liquid water content of snow pack
variable.longName: The total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the whole depth of the snow pack of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
Preciptiation, includes both solid and liquid phases
Evaporation at surface: flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)
Water evaporation from soil (including sublimation)
The canopy evaporation and sublimation; may include dew formation as a negative flux.
Transpiration
Near-surface air temperature at reference height
Grid cell average albedo for all wavelengths.
Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

variable.standardName: Liquid water content of soil layer
variable.longName: In each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

variable.standardName: Frozen water content of soil layer
variable.longName: In each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
Mean active layer depth
Maximum active layer depth
Minimum Active Layer Depth

variable.standardName: Mean depth to frozen water table
variable.longName: Mean depth to frozen water table

variable.standardName: Maximum depth to frozen water table
variable.longName: Maximum depth to frozen water table

variable.standardName: Minimum depth to frozen water table
variable.longName: Minimum depth to frozen water table
Energy associated with phase change of water in snow pack
Snow thickness (snorow/rhosnow)
Vegetation Canopy Temperature
Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiative flux in air
Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiative flux in air
Wind speed at reference height
Specific humidity at reference height
Air pressure at reference height
Surface (skin) temperature
Intercepted frozen water stored on canopy
Intercepted liquid water stored on canopy
Bulk temperature of the snow, not the surface (skin) temperature
Temperature of water ponded on the soil surface
Depth of water ponded on the soil surface
Diagnosed effective surface black-body temperature
Density of snow pack
The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).
Interflow runoff, not including baseflow or overland flow
Subsurface runoff (baseflow, not including interflow)
Surface drag coefficient for heat
Surface drag coefficient for momentum
Heat conduction between soil layers
the mass per unit area (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases

variable.standardName: Total water content of soil layer
variable.longName: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
Albedo of the snow-covered surface, averaged over the grid cell.
Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)
Ground heat flux accounts for the energy gained or lost during belowground warming or cooling.
Leaf maintenance respiration, does not include growth respiration
Leaf Area Index
Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation
Carbon Mass in Stem including sapwood and hardwood.
Carbon mass per unit area in roots, including fine and coarse roots.
Carbon Mass in Litter Pool

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool
variable.longName: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

variable.standardName: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
variable.longName: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
Vegetation height over the vegetated fraction of the gridcell.

variable.standardName: Net Primary Productivity of Biomass Expressed As Carbon
variable.longName: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

variable.standardName: Gross Primary Productivity of Biomass Expressed As Carbon
variable.longName: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

variable.standardName: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land
variable.longName: Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire. Positive flux is into the land. emissions from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

variable.standardName: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Productivity on Land
variable.longName: This is the net mass flux of carbon from atmosphere into land, calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbon fluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land
variable.longName: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)
Autotrophic Respiration from All Vegetation Pools
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land

variable.standardName: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
variable.longName: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

variable.standardName: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
variable.longName: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

variable.standardName: Fraction of Area by Vegetation/Land Cover Category
variable.longName: Fraction of grid cell area occupied by different model vegetation/land cover categories.

variable.standardName: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere
variable.longName: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass in Model Litter Pool per layer
variable.longName: Carbon mass in the form of litter per ground layer of the soil model.

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool per layer
variable.longName: Carbon mass per ground layer of the soil model.
Carbon mass per unit area in leaves. (monthly is mid month value)
Total soil respiration (sum of heterotrophic respiration plus root contributions of autotrophic - maintenance and growth - respiration)

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO2 Emission from Fire
variable.longName: CO2 emissions (expressed as a CO2 mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change)

variable.standardName: Fraction of Entire Grid cell that is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
variable.longName: Fraction of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
variable.longName: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through land use change.

variable.standardName: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere
variable.longName: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

variable.standardName: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CH4 Emission from Fire
variable.longName: CH4 emissions (expressed as a CH4 mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model

variable.standardName: CO Flux into Atmosphere due to Fire
variable.longName: CO emissions (expressed as a CO mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model

variable.standardName: BC Flux into Atmosphere due to Fire
variable.longName: Black carbon emissions (expressed as a BC mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model

variable.standardName: OC Flux into Atmosphere due to Fire
variable.longName: Organic carbon emissions (expressed as a OC mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model

variable.standardName: NOx Flux into Atmosphere due to Fire
variable.longName: NOx emissions (expressed as a NOx mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model

variable.standardName: NMHC Flux into Atmosphere due to Fire
variable.longName: Non-methane hydrocarbon emissions (expressed as a NMHC mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model

variable.standardName: Deforested biomass that goes into atmosphere as a result of anthropogenic land use change
variable.longName: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed.

variable.standardName: Deforested biomass that goes into litter as a result of anthropogenic land use change
variable.longName: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed and some transferred to litter.

variable.standardName: Deforested biomass that goes into soil as a result of anthropogenic land use change
variable.longName: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed and some transferred to soil.
When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. This is the total amount of C

variable.standardName: Boolean for existance of Vegetation/Land Cover Category based on bioclimatic indices (1 is exist, 0 is not)
variable.longName: Boolean for existance of Vegetation/Land Cover Category based on bioclimatic indices
Tracer of leaf carbon (can be simple tracer, 13C or 14C)
Tracer of soil carbon (can be simple tracer, 14C or 13C)
Tracer of litter carbon (can be simple tracer, 14C or 13C)
Tracer of stem carbon (can be simple tracer, 14C or 13C)
Tracer of root carbon (can be simple tracer, 14C or 13C)
Methane emissions from specified wetland areas based on heterotrophic respiration
Methane emissions from dynamically determined wetland areas based on heterotrophic respiration
Methane uptake (methanotrophy) by oxic soils

variable.standardName: Fraction of a grid cell covered by wetland
variable.longName: Fraction of a grid cell covered by wetland. Prognostically determined.
Wetland fraction prescribed from an external input file
